content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Accessibility Tree with numerical label representing information about the page, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
4) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {Accessibility Tree of a web page}

Now given a task: Find the button to share arxiv non-profit store and follow the QR code to share the shop. Then add arXiv Forever short sleeve (XL) to your cart.  Please interact with https://arxiv.org/ and get the answer.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to look for link to store; scroll page to find.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to go to arXiv main homepage to look for store link.
Action: Click [135]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to look for store/shop link likely near footer; scroll further down.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To locate the “arXiv non‑profit store”, using Google will be faster than scrolling this long homepage for an elusive link.  
Action: Google
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Perform Google search for “arxiv store” to locate arXiv’s merchandise site quickly.  
Action: Type [2]; arxiv store
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Google search blocked. Return to arXiv homepage and continue manual exploration; perhaps store link is in header.
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Directly open arXiv’s site by typing its URL, bypassing Google search.  
Action: Type [2]; https://arxiv.org/
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Google is blocking; I should return to the last arXiv page I was on and keep exploring it for the store link.  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to return to arXiv site. Use Google search box to search simple term “arxiv” (not the full URL) which is less likely to trigger captcha, then click the arxiv.org result.  
Action: Type [2]; arxiv
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Google is blocking again; just navigate back through history until the arXiv site reappears.  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Return further back in history to the arXiv page so I can continue looking for its store link directly on the site (Google keeps blocking).  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to look for a “store” or “shop” link; try scrolling toward the top where main header/hero likely sits.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The link “Membership & Giving” might host a link to the non‑profit store / merchandise.  
Action: Click [3353]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Membership & Giving” link is likely farther down; I need to scroll lower so it becomes clickable.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Explore “Membership & Giving” which likely hosts donation and merchandise store links.  
Action: Click [3353]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Try opening the “General information” page first; from the About section we can look for links to the store.  
Action: Click [3343]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Scroll a bit further down to ensure the “Membership & Giving” link is in view before clicking.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Membership & Giving” link (3353) should lead to arXiv’s donation / merchandise section where the non‑profit store link likely sits.  
Action: Click [3353]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Membership & Giving” link likely isn’t yet in the visible viewport, so clicking fails. I’ll scroll a bit farther down to bring that section into view first.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Membership & Giving” link (3353) is now in the visible part of the page and should open the donations/merchandise section where the non‑profit store link is likely found.  
Action: Click [3353]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Swag” link (3600) under the Brand navigation likely leads to arXiv’s merchandise / non‑profit store page.  
Action: Click [3600]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Bring the “Brand” navigation section (where the “Swag” link resides) fully into the viewport so the link can be clicked successfully.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Swag” link (numerical label 3600) under the “Brand” section will likely take me to arXiv’s non‑profit merchandise store, so I should click it.
Action: Click [3600]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To make sure the “Swag” link is actually inside the visible viewport (so a click will succeed), I should scroll a bit further down first.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still haven’t scrolled far enough for the “Swag” link (3600) in the Brand section to be inside the viewport; another small scroll should bring it into clickable range.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Swag” link (3600) in the Brand navigation should open arXiv’s merchandise store.  
Action: Click [3600]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Swag” link (label 3600) under the Brand section is present in the current tree; it should take us to the merchandise page where the non‑profit store lives, so click it.
Action: Click [3600]

Observation: please analyze the accessibility tree and give the Thought and Action.

Action: Scroll WINDOW; down

Observation: please analyze the accessibility tree and give the Thought and Action.
